metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12770 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.6.11. sg_write lacksan sg_remove_request call in a certain failure case, aka CID-83c6f2390040.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12770` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-185.215
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-107.108~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-107.108~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-107.108~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1076.83
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1110.121
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1074.78~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1091.101~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1078.88~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1046.50~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1135.144
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1139.147
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-185.215').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-107.108~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1076.83').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1110.121').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1074.78~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.101~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1078.88~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1046.50~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1135.144').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.147').
